Description: Shaman are people in close attunement with the spirits.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).
Proficiency Requirements: You have Proficiency in Occultism and a number of extra Proficiencies equal to your Intelligence.

~Proficiency in Occultism~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for knowing about demons or undead, rituals, myths or cryptids, black magic, etc.

Proficiencies Description: No two shamans are alike - each specializes in a different type of magic, with different customs and personalized rituals and beliefs. As such, you have Proficiencies in Occultism, and any extra proficiencies you need based on your intelligence.

Spellcasting.Spell Grade: 6 + Sense, Intelligence or Charisma, whichever is higher
Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells and Talents inbetween Adventures.
Spellcasting.Other: All Shaman-specific Abilities are considered Spells (unless stated otherwise).

Mana.Regain: You regain all Mana back inbetween Adventures.

Spellcasting.Recommended Abilities Description:
Chilling Shout is a great way to spend Mana to deal damage. Invigorate will keep your party alive - make sure you keep them at full health! Panic Lash will come in handy against enemies that heal, or in case you ever need just a Half-Action. Confusion is a very good source of distruption, and Restoration will bring your party back from being Fallen with no repercussions.
The last suggestion is Mastery. This one is very situational, as it allows you to use your Sense or Charisma to attack with weapons instead of Might or Dexterity. If you already have high Might and Dexterity, consider getting something else instead. A good recommendation is Speak With Animals for some extra utility for your group.

Other:
As a Shaman, you have a spirit animal that represents you.
Choose one of the following spirit animals.
You will permanently gain the bonuses of that spirit animal.

Starting Abilities Description.Animal Spirit:
As a Shaman, you have a spirit animal that you choose when you create your character.
This spirit animal accompanies you spiritually.
The spirit animal is generally invisible and manifests as a ghostly presence when you use the Ability specific to it.

~Echoes~.Cooldown: Each Spell can only echo once per Combat
~Echoes~.Effect:
After you cast a Basic Ability you spent Mana on, if you roll maximum on at least one ^immediate^ Damage or Healing die, the Ability _echoes_ and you cast it again (for 0 Actions), but all Damage or Healing it does is reduced by 50%.
The _echoed_ Ability can't affect the same target(s) or area.
~Echoes~.Notes:
Immediate means not delayed, not over time, etc (e.g. Scorching Rays, Healing Surge, Mind Blast are immediate; Explosion Rune, Curse of Pain, etc are not immediate). _Echoing_ can only happen if you roll maximum on the initial cast (when you spend the Mana), even if there's more Damage or Healing later (e.g. Crackling Lightning _echoes_ only if you roll maximum the moment you cast it).
If the area overlaps the initial area, the overlapped part has no effect. If it hits the same target(s), it has no effect on them.
Take the Ability text as it is - _echoing_ Lightning Storm repeats the initial Damage, but you'd have to spend another 1 Action to retrigger the second Lightning Storm.
The GM has the word on whether something is possible.

~Mind Link~.Effect:
Establish a mind connection with a willing ally.
For the rest of the Adventure, you can talk to eachother telepathically.

Choices: Berserker, a heavy fighter, guided by the ways of the spirits, both wise and strong - a combination to fear
Seer, one who can perceive beyond the eyes and ears, who can get to the root of your mind and soul
Witch Doctor, a strange ally when it comes to helping, and en even stranger foe when it comes to combat

~Path of the Berserker~.Effect:
Instead of having normal Health Regen, 200% of your Health Regen is added to your Max Health (and as such your Health Regen after combat is always 0).
You can not gain extra Defense from Armor or Shields.
~Path of the Berserker~.Notes: Increasing Health Regen increases your Max Health instead (and losing Health Regen loses you Max Health instead).

~Bloodlust~.Effect: Add Damage to a weapon attack equal to 50% of your missing Health.
~Bloodlust~.Notes: This is not considered a Spell.

<Primal Trophy>.Effect:
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, gain one Primal Trophy. Every 4 Primal Trophies increase your Max Health by 1.
Every 10 Primal Trophies give you an extra Proficiency.

<Cold Vigor>.Effect: Heal for 10% of your Max Health and remove diseases from yourself.

<Spirit Animal>.Effect:
A spirit animal assists you and gives you a boon, depending on its type.
You can change which spirit animal assists you while not in Combat.
<Spirit Animal>.Upgrade: The spirit animal is intangible, and invisible to most people, but can't walk through solid surfaces. You can see through its eyes, but is bound to you and won't go more than 15 meters away from you.
<Spirit Animal>.Notes: An Act counts as ranged if it's not made with a melee weapon, and the range is at least 3 meters

Values: You are immune to Slows and Fumbling

<Earthshattering Wave>.Effect:
All units in a line must pass a Might Check or be Stunned. If they pass, they become Fumbling instead.
The line is 3 meters wide, and has a length of 1 meter for ever 5 Health you are missing.
<Earthshattering Wave>.Notes:
E.g. if you have 30 out of 50 Health (thus missing 20 Health), then the line will be 4 meters long.
Cover is applied normally.

<Ruining Shout>.Effect:
Damages all Enemies within 4 meters of you.
Deals 1d6 Psychic Damage (directly, ignoring Defense) for each 1 meter to the target (up to 4d6).
Roll 4d6 at the same time, and choose which dice affect the units closer.

<Tribal Tattoos>.Effect:
Your Max Health is further increased by 8.
Every Adventure, you add another tattoo and increase it by 1.
Every 3 new tattoos, gain +1 in any Resist Check of choice.

<Jotunn>.Effect:
You grow to the size of a giant and become Large.
You gain Shielding equal to 50% of your missing Health.
Your normal Melee attacks hit all Units within 1 meter of the target for the same Damage, without the Stat modifier (e.g. you don't add your Might or Dexterity to the secondary targets).
You are immune to being Slowed, Rooted, Crippled, Fumbling and to Hard Terrain.

<Echoing Strikes>.Effect: Your weapon attacks can _echo_ (if you roll one maximum die).

<Forced Echoes>.Effect: Your Shaman Abilities and Talents always _echo_.
<Forced Echoes>.Notes: When Bloodlust echoes, the Damage is dealt directly to another target near you (reduced by 50% from Damage it would normally do).

~Spirit Bond~.Effect:
Touch another ally.
Whenever either of you makes a Check, add the higher bonus from either of you instead of their normal Check bonus.
~Spirit Bond~.Notes: This does apply to Proficiencies - if your bonded ally has Proficiency in something, you also add the ally's Level, as it would normally make sense.

~Third Echo~.Effect: When you roll dice for your _echoed_ Spell, if you roll maximum on any of the _echoed_ dice as well, the Spell _echoes_ a third time!

<Spirit Animal>.Effect:
A spirit animal assists you and gives you a boon, depending on its type.
You can change which spirit animal assists you while not in Combat.
<Spirit Animal>.Upgrade: The spirit animal is intangible, and invisible to most people, but can't walk through solid surfaces. You can see through its eyes, but is bound to you and won't go more than 15 meters away from you.
<Spirit Animal>.Notes: An Act counts as ranged if it's not made with a melee weapon, and the range is at least 3 meters

Values: You are immune to Slows and Fumbling

<Incorporeal Form>.Effect:
You become a bodyless soul for up to 8 hours and enter a willing ally.
While inside the ally's body, you can communicate with them mentally, and only they can see you.
You can slightly peek outside of their body, and move your arms, upper body and head as if you were a ghost originating from that ally's body.
{Diamond} You can't move yourself, but you always move with that ally.
{Diamond} You can't do any physical actions (because you are a ghost and can't touch anything or anyone).
{Diamond} You can cast spells normally. 
{Diamond} You follow your own Initiative in combat.
{Diamond} You can't take Damage or Crowd Control from external sources, but you feel every body sensation that ally feels.
You can freely exit their body and revert back to your physical self using 0 Actions.

<Dream Walk>.Effect:
A non-Epic Unit must pass a Sense Check or fall Asleep for 1 turn.
Alternatively, you can use Dream Walk on an already sleeping target to alter their dreams to your liking.
<Dream Walk>.Notes: A Sleeping Unit wakes up if it takes Damage or other Crowd Control.

<Enlightening Ritual>.Effect:
You undergo an isolated, personal and mind-altering ritual with a willing non-Warlock Player Character at a campfire, and using incense, smoke and special herbs.
The ally must make a Sense Check (against your Spell Grade).
If it passes, its Max Mana permanently increases by 1, and gets +2 to all Checks for the rest of the Adventure.
If it fails, it takes 1d8 Psychic Damage and gets -1 to all Checks for the rest of the Adventure.
<Enlightening Ritual>.Upgrade:
You can perform this ritual as many times as you want per Adventure until you succeed once. It costs you 1 Mana (not Max Mana), which is spent when the ally passes the ritual.
A person can only succeed one Enlightening Ritual in their lifetime.

<Rainmaking>.Effect:
Perform a ritual to change the weather or atmosphere on a 100 meter area (in diameter) centered on you.
Choose one option from Storm, Wind, Heat, Cold.
<Rainmaking>.Notes: In dungeons and indoors, this only goes through open doors and spaces - the weather starts from you and extends as much as possible through open holes, windows, doors, etc.

Values: Your team deals 2 extra Damage with all Spells
Your team has +1 Movement Speed, +1 Damage with missiles and can freely jump 5 meters (using Movement)
Your team deals 2 extra Damage with physical weapons

<Psyche Tether>.Effect:
Place a tether on 2 Units within 10 meters of you.
The next time one of them is Damaged or Healed, the other one takes the Damage (as Psychic Damage) or Healing as well.
<Psyche Tether>.Notes:
If both are Damaged/Healed at the same time, this only applies once and you choose which takes the Damage/Healing of the other.
The extra Damage of Smites, Ambush, etc over an attack counts as the same Damage source.

<Forced Echoes>.Effect: Your Shaman Abilities and Talents always _echo_.
<Forced Echoes>.Notes: Rainmaking applies 2 effects when echoed. Enlightening Ritual can now, instead, succeed twice per Adventure (Units still can't succeed it more than once).

<Synchronicity>.Effect: Your Basic Abilities that don't cost Mana and deal Damage can now also _echo_.

<Reincarnation>.Effect:
Use when you or an ally you can see Falls or dies. Choose an animal from the Pets and Animals list.
They immediately come to life as a translucent spirit version of that Animal.
Lasts until the ally Rises (or the animal dies too).
<Reincarnation>.Upgrade: The ally can do Animal Attack (Druid), which does 1d6 + ^their Sense^ Damage (for a Half-Action).

~Wicked Magic~.Effect: You have access to the Eldritch Spell List.

~Hex Magic~.Effect:
After you cast a Spell, you can expend 6 Health to force it to _echo_.
You can expend 3 Health to add or subtract 1d6 from any other Unit's roll (not yours).
~Hex Magic~.Notes:
The GM might not roll Damage for monsters, and instead take the average - even if they take the average, that counts as a roll.
Keep in mind you only have 1 Reaction per Round.

<Voodoo Magic>.Effect:
A Unit within 6 meters makes a Sense Check.
If it fails, it takes 2d6 Psychic Damage at the start of your every turn for 1 minute, and for its next turn, you can choose that enemy's Acts as long as it would seem reasonable to that enemy (decide with your GM).
Epic Monsters can not be controlled; they only take the Damage.
<Voodoo Magic>.Notes: For example, you can make a goblin run or recklessly attack one of your party members. But you can't make a guard jump off a cliff, because that's not what it would normally do.

<Corpseblast>.Effect:
Use the moment a Worthy Unit dies.
Explode the corpse, dealing 1d4 Poison Damage to all Units near it.
Heal for the Damage dealt.

<Blood Brew>.Effect:
You spend 10 minutes creating a strange splashable brew made from your own blood, with a random effect.
The brew can be splashed (Half-Action) onto a Unit (at 3 meters range).
When you create it, roll 1d4 to determine its effect.
You are immune to Blood Brews.
<Blood Brew>.Notes: The brews lose their effect at the end of the Adventure. Acid and Muck ignore real Cover.

Values: Target takes 1d8 Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check or be Blinded
Deals 1d12 Damage in a 5x5 area centered on the target, and a Toxic Gas cloud forms there.

<Bone Mass>.Effect:
Declare a square area with a diameter equal to the Health spent.
Sharp bones grow from the area (occupying 1x1 meters each).
When a Unit steps on a Sharp Bone, it directly takes 1d8 Pierce Damage and loses 1 meter of its remaining speed.
The bone then shatters.

<Dead Hands>.Effect:
Declare a square area with a diameter equal to the Health spent.
Undead hands appear in that area and make it Hard Terrain.
At the start of your next turn, summon a number of Zombies equal to half the Health spent, each wherever you choose in that area.
They take their turn the same time as you and you can command them to do move and attack (they can't do Default Moves or use items).
They have 4 Speed, 1 Health, 2 Defense and fail all Checks.
Each can attack for 1d4 - 1 Necrotic Damage, but ignore Defense.
Zombies last for up to 10 minutes.

<Schizophrenic Suggestion>.Effect:
Declare a square area with a diameter equal to ^twice^ the Health spent.
All Units in that area must pass a Sense Check or instantly make an attack or offensive Ability of its choice, at full strength, on its closest ally.
<Schizophrenic Suggestion>.Notes: Monsters can use any of their Abilities that do Damage or Crowd Control, and target them however they want if they are Area Abilities, as long as it hits its closest ally.

<Bumboclaat!>.Effect:
Target a Unit.
The next time it would take Damage from any source before your next turn, the Damage is doubled (after Defense).
<Bumboclaat!>.Upgrade: You can only use this on targets that have blood.
<Bumboclaat!>.Notes: Applies to added extra Damage if it's the same type as the base Damage (e.g. Advanced Flank works, but not Smites).

<Forced Echoes>.Notes: You don't spend Health again if any Talents require that.

<Possession>.Effect:
Choose a Unit you can see.
You possess its body and, on its next turn, you control what it does.
<Possession>.Upgrades:
Only works on targets with Sense less than 3.
The GM will tell you what the Unit can do if it's a monster.
